Metrolinx
is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you!
PRESTO is an electronic fare system that allows transit users in the Greater Toronto and Hamilton Area (GTHA) and Ottawa to use a Smart Card to move between and within transit systems. PRESTO makes transit travel easier and more convenient. PRESTO Controllership is adding a finance professional to its team to provide strategic support in financial accounting and reporting.
What will I be doing?
Provides financial and strategic analyses, reports and the necessary financial modelling with focus on workforce planning including capital project labour costing, budgeting and forecast.
Develops commentary, memos and presentation on financial analyses and reports for Senior Management and presents them to aid decision making.
Conducts financial analyses in support of business operations using proper accounting treatment including reconciliation of accounts and reviewing month end close entries to ensure integrity of financial data.
Champions process improvement initiatives, evaluates the implications of new processes, systems and projects from a financial perspective, to include assessment of assumptions, limitations, cost-benefit implications, controls and risks prior to implementation.
Creates and applies reporting templates, financial models and automated processes in order to meet legal and corporate standards, including meeting deadlines.
Provides subject matter expertise to support non-finance business partners and leaders (i.e. operations, business development, etc.).
Supports development of business cases and return on investment analysis presentation and financial models.
Provides Guidance and mentors other financial professionals on the team; establishing policies and procedures for analysis and reporting and reviewing their work.
What skills and qualifications do I need?
Completion of a degree in Accounting, Finance, Math, Commerce, or related field – or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent
Minimum six (6) years’ progressive experience as a financial analyst. Four (4) years’ progressive experience as a senior financial analyst preferred.
Chartered Professional Accountant or other accounting designation a strong asset.
Experience providing subject matter expertise to non-finance business leaders, partners and committee members, assisting in interpretation of financial data for decision-making and providing commentary.
Understand the financial an accounting impact of business processes to evaluate current and future business activities (e.g. audit, legal, and reporting requirements).
Demonstrated experience in budget development, tracking, forecasting, business planning, and reporting, and conducting financial analysis related to resource allocation is an asset.
Proficiency with financial management systems and computer technology to develop and implement financial/accounting controls and procedures, and implement and enhance systems.
Well-rounded experience with accounting systems, controls and procedures
Knowledge of Public Sector Accounting Standards is an asset.
Proficient in MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.), Oracle, Hyperion
Good interpersonal and excellent oral/written/presentation communication skills

Title: Junior Business Analyst intern - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Let’s talk about pizza! (Disclaimer:
This is a legitimate job posting! We like to have fun with our role descriptions)
What comes to mind when you first think of pizza? Besides now craving a slice... Perhaps you think of the toppings or how long it'll take to arrive.
What you might not have thought of is every teeny tiny, little step that needs to take place for that savory pie to magically appear at your doorstep. Or, maybe you have and you're that sort of critical thinker we're after!
Consider for a moment how one restaurant manages to source flour from a faraway wheat field to the vendor that orchestrates the cardboard your 'zza will be delivered in; and even how that delivery person will get paid.
There's a lot going on behind the scenes of any business that, if done right, consumers don’t even need to think about; like, purchase orders, invoices, payroll, shipping, etc. That's where Paragon (https://www.paragon-erp.com/) comes in to save the day!
Our cloud-based ERP software (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5JN2utKIjVo) helps our customers (from a variety of industries) focus on what matters. Whether that is making delicious pizzas, creating cool t-shirts, building beautiful jewelry or whatever inspired them to start their business in the first place. We make the grunt work easy so they can focus on what they love to do.
Ultimately, you will have to understand the customer’s realities in order to help customize Paragon to better serve them and make their lives easier.
As a Junior Business Analyst, you’ll learn how to analyze and work with complex data, design workflows and use cases, and provide suggestions on how to improve current practices and implementation procedures & more.
You will work closely with customers getting to know their processes. You’ll have to put yourself into the shoes of every person who might use the system (from the accounting clerk and warehouse pickers all the way through to the CEO) and figure out how they can do their job flawlessly in Paragon. You’ll make our customer work flows more efficient and organized helping them save time AND money. You will be integral in implementing Paragon for our customers to prioritize their requirements based on business value, risks and company objectives. And, you’ll be a master at managing and keeping track of all your different tasks, deliverables and projects.
About YOU:
You're a go-getter who loves things to be well-organized and coordinated (You are a pro when it comes to spreadsheets)
Great listener & excellent communicator in English & French
Quick learner, curious and a problem solver
You have experience with business analytics and live for this stuff!
Thorough, accountable and can take initiative
Passionate about businesses and how they run
You know great customer service when you see it (but better yet, you bring it!)
Team player yet also autonomous and work really well independently
About us:
We're a friendly bunch who like to have fun (https://www.jonar.com/blog/staff-meetings-at-jonar)
We take our work seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously
We like to challenge the status quo and each other
We are team oriented at Jonar and happy to help out our fellow Jonerds.
We’re not perfect, we make mistakes but we ‘fess up and learn from it
We enjoy hanging out together after work too (literally - some of us go rock climbing or enjoy grabbing drinks)
We've been named as one of the "Best Workplaces in Quebec (https://www.jonar.com/blog/50-best-places-to-work-in-quebec/)".
We lead daily meditations if you’re into that and we have great virtual & mental health benefits.
We're excited to read your application (we really like unique submissions, read more about it here (https://www.jonar.com/blog/dear-candidate))
You might be hungry for pizza right now but we hope you're also hungry for the possibilities that await you at Jonar. Apply Now!

At CN, everyday brings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environment where you’re part of making sure our business is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time Intern, Intern, Forensic Accounting position in Montreal, Quebec for summer 2022.
Job Summary
The Intern, Forensic Accounting is responsible for carrying out duties under the supervision and guidance of the Forensic Accounting Management. The incumbent participates in completing assignments related to forensic investigations and data analytics initiatives.
Major Responsibilities
Assist in the executing forensic investigations
Extract data from CN systems and ensure information completeness and accuracy
Perform investigation steps, including data analytics and inspection of documents
Evaluate information and provide a preliminary assessment
Provide documentation in support of forensic investigations
Requirements
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in a team
Time management skills
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word)
Fluently bilingual both written and verbal (English, French)

About CN
CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.
